problems.title: Determine Day of Week Using Zeller's Congruence
problems.description:
Given a date (day, month, year), determine the day of the week using conditional logic.

Print the day: "Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", or "Saturday".

Note: Use Zeller's Congruence algorithm:
- If month < 3, month += 12, year -= 1
- h = (day + (13*(month+1)/5) + year + year/4 - year/100 + year/400) mod 7
- Map h (0-6) to days: 0=Saturday, 1=Sunday, 2=Monday, ..., 6=Friday

Input Format:
Three integers: day month year

Output Format:
Print the day of the week.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
15 3 2024

Sample Output
Friday

Sample Input
1 1 2024

Sample Output
Monday

Explanation:
Implement Zeller's Congruence with careful handling of month adjustments and modulo operations using nested conditions.
hintsList: Adjust month if < 3. Calculate Zeller's formula with integer division. Map result (0-6) to day names using if-else or switch-case.
